sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
loses something
, nečesa ne najde.

seg.quote: You haven't lost the ticket, have you?
She's always losing her cigarette lighter.
They lost their way in the woods.

sense.def:
To lose something
rečemo tudi tedaj, ko nečesa nimamo več, čeprav bi tisto radi imeli.

seg.quote: ...a complete list of all the goods lost in the fire.
He lost the use of his legs.

sense.def:
To lose a quality or characteristic
pomeni imati manj neke lastnosti ali značilnosti kot prej.

seg.quote: He has lost a lot of weight.
Brody was beginning to lose interest.

sense.def:
To lose a relative or friend
pomeni, da nam sorodnik ali prijatelj umre.

seg.quote: I lost my father when I was nine.

sense.def:
To lose an opportunity
ali
to lose time
pomeni zapraviti priložnost ali čas.

seg.quote: Bill lost no time in telling everyone about his idea.
He will lose his chances of promotion.

sense.def:
Kadar neko podjetje
loses money
, zasluži manj, kot porabi.

Kadar ročna ali stenska ura
loses time
, kaže, da je bolj zgodaj, kot je v resnici.

To lose a competition or argument
pomeni, da je nekdo na tekmovanju ali pri dokazovanju boljši od nas in nas premaga.

seg.quote: They expected to lose the election.
He'd never played on a losing side.

sense.def:
To have something to lose
pomeni, da bi lahko trpeli, če bi nekaj storili neuspešno.

seg.quote: The price was too high and he had too much to lose.
They had absolutely nothing to lose.

sense.def:
To lose sight of something
pomeni nečesa ne več videti.

To lose out
pomeni pretrpeti izgubo ali škodo.

seg.quote: They did not lose out in the struggle to keep up with inflation.
